disclaimer: This is informational only. Contact the court directly for current procedures.

court.name: Knox County General Sessions Court - Civil Division
court.address: 300 Main Street, City County Building, Knoxville, TN 37902
court.parking: Main Street Garage (free for first 2 hours)

requiredDocuments: Detainer Warrant form (available at clerk's office)

answer.recommended: File at least 2 business days before hearing

hearingProcedures.location: City County Building, Courtrooms on 4th Floor

checkIn.description: Check docket posted on courtroom door
checkIn.arrivalTime: At least 20 minutes before scheduled time

continuances.policy: First continuance typically granted on request
continuances.method: Request from judge at hearing or file written motion

legalAidResources.name: Legal Aid of East Tennessee
legalAidResources.address: 502 South Gay Street, Suite 400, Knoxville, TN 37902
legalAidResources.eligibility: Income-qualified tenants (typically 200% of federal poverty level)
legalAidResources.intake: Call for telephone screening; walk-in intake available

legalAidResources.name: University of Tennessee Legal Clinic
services: Law student representation under faculty supervision

legalAidResources.name: Knoxville Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service

specialNotes: Free parking available in Main Street Garage (validate at clerk's office)
Security screening required at building entrance
Spanish interpretation available with advance notice
Court staff can provide procedural information but not legal advice
Small claims and detainer dockets run together - arrive early
proceduralTips: Bring original and 2 copies of all documents
Be prepared to wait - dockets can be lengthy
Know exactly how much rent you owe (if nonpayment case)
Have your defense organized before hearing
